trailingComments.value:
*
 * The `Search` component displays a menu of as-you-type results from a variety
 * of sources.
 *
 * The search box will be 'activated' if the app's current controller implements
 * a `searching` method that returns a truthy value. If this is the case, an 'x'
 * button will be shown next to the search field, and clicking it will call the
 * `clearSearch` method on the controller.

leadingComments.value:
*
     * The value of the search input.
     *
     * @type {Function}

trailingComments.value:
*
     * Whether or not the search input has focus.
     *
     * @type {Boolean}

leadingComments.value:
*
     * Whether or not the search input has focus.
     *
     * @type {Boolean}

trailingComments.value:
*
     * An array of SearchSources.
     *
     * @type {SearchSource[]}

leadingComments.value:
*
     * An array of SearchSources.
     *
     * @type {SearchSource[]}

trailingComments.value:
*
     * The number of sources that are still loading results.
     *
     * @type {Integer}

leadingComments.value:
*
     * The number of sources that are still loading results.
     *
     * @type {Integer}

trailingComments.value:
*
     * A list of queries that have been searched for.
     *
     * @type {Array}

leadingComments.value:
*
     * A list of queries that have been searched for.
     *
     * @type {Array}

trailingComments.value:
*
     * The index of the currently-selected <li> in the results list. This can be
     * a unique string (to account for the fact that an item's position may jump
     * around as new results load), but otherwise it will be numeric (the
     * sequential position within the list).
     *
     * @type {String|Integer}

leadingComments.value:
*
     * The index of the currently-selected <li> in the results list. This can be
     * a unique string (to account for the fact that an item's position may jump
     * around as new results load), but otherwise it will be numeric (the
     * sequential position within the list).
     *
     * @type {String|Integer}

trailingComments.value: Initialize search input value in the view rather than the constructor so
that we have access to app.current.

leadingComments.value: Initialize search input value in the view rather than the constructor so
that we have access to app.current.

trailingComments.value: Initialize search sources in the view rather than the constructor so
that we have access to app.forum.

that we have access to app.forum.

trailingComments.value: Hide the search view if no sources were loaded

Highlight the item that is currently selected.

trailingComments.value: Whenever the mouse is hovered over a search result, highlight it.

leadingComments.value: Whenever the mouse is hovered over a search result, highlight it.

*
   * Set the currently-selected search result item to the one with the given

   * index.

*
 * The `Search` component displays a menu of as-you-type results from a variety
 * of sources.
 *
 * The search box will be 'activated' if the app's current controller implements
 * a `searching` method that returns a truthy value. If this is the case, an 'x'
 * button will be shown next to the search field, and clicking it will call the
 * `clearSearch` method on the controller.

comments.value:
*
 * The `Search` component displays a menu of as-you-type results from a variety
 * of sources.
 *
 * The search box will be 'activated' if the app's current controller implements
 * a `searching` method that returns a truthy value. If this is the case, an 'x'
 * button will be shown next to the search field, and clicking it will call the
 * `clearSearch` method on the controller.

*
     * The value of the search input.
     *
     * @type {Function}

*
     * Whether or not the search input has focus.
     *
     * @type {Boolean}

*
     * An array of SearchSources.
     *
     * @type {SearchSource[]}

*
     * The number of sources that are still loading results.
     *
     * @type {Integer}

*
     * A list of queries that have been searched for.
     *
     * @type {Array}

*
     * The index of the currently-selected <li> in the results list. This can be
     * a unique string (to account for the fact that an item's position may jump
     * around as new results load), but otherwise it will be numeric (the
     * sequential position within the list).
     *
     * @type {String|Integer}
Initialize search input value in the view rather than the constructor so
that we have access to app.current.
Initialize search sources in the view rather than the constructor so
that we have access to app.forum.
Hide the search view if no sources were loaded
Highlight the item that is currently selected.
Whenever the mouse is hovered over a search result, highlight it.
Handle input key events on the search input, triggering results to load.

*
   * Get the active search in the app's current controller.
   *
   * @return {String}

*
   * Navigate to the currently selected search result and close the list.

*
   * Clear the search input and the current controller's active search.

*
   * Build an item list of SearchSources.
   *
   * @return {ItemList}

*
   * Get all of the search result items that are selectable.
   *
   * @return {jQuery}

*
   * Get the position of the currently selected search result item.
   *
   * @return {Integer}

*
   * Get the <li> in the search results with the given index (numeric or named).
   *
   * @param {String} index
   * @return {DOMElement}

*
   * Set the currently-selected search result item to the one with the given
   * index.
   *
   * @param {Integer} index
   * @param {Boolean} scrollToItem Whether or not to scroll the dropdown so that
   *     the item is in view.
